FuncDef:
The interface command displays the view of an existing interface or creates a logical interface and displays the view of the logical interface.
The undo interface command deletes a logical interface.
By default, this type of port is not created.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies an interface name.
The value is a string of 1 to 63 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Specifies the type and number of an interface.
For details, see Hardware Description.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
Physical interfaces cannot be created. The interface command can be used only to enter the view of an existing physical interface.
Logical interfaces can be created. The interface command can be used to create a logical interface and display the view of the logical interface.
Precautions
After a logical interface is deleted using the undo interface command, all the configurations on the interface are automatically deleted. These configurations cannot be restored even if you create an interface same as the one deleted.
